name: LHotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this intimate and lovely hotel filled with incredible artwork for two nights, following a cruise from Boston to Motreal. Room was large,well-appointed and quiet - outstanding value. Staff was friendly and helpful - certainly well above average. Gret location for seeing the city but immediate surrounding neighborhood uneven. Apart from artwork - which was being taken down when we were leaving (?) - other hotel amenities good but not great. Interestingly, two movies were being filmed in the neighborhood the weekend we stayed there, icluding one in the street in front of the hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends.
reviews.title: Fantastic Artwork

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I stayed here in early October 2011 and we loved the location in Old Montreal. It is walking distance to two subways stations (under 10 minutes), Notre Dame Basilica and the best restaurants in the city. The staff were very helpful and they were friendly and cool without being overly formal. We had a basic room and it was nice. It had a desk, closet and comfortable bed -- no couch. My only complaint would be a lack of bathroom fan, which meant foggy showers and offered nothing in the way of privacy when you wished to -- ahem -- use the facilities. But I would absolutely stay here again.
reviews.title: Great location; cozy room; free wireless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don’t think that there are enough wonderful things that I can say about L Hotel in Montreal.
reviews.title: Magnifique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there the weekend of Sept 17-19. We had booked on the hotel’s website after reading reviews on Trip Advisor. We were upgraded to a beautiful suite on the second floor. The suite consisted of a bedroom and a sitting room along with a very large bathroom. The television included several US stations as well as local stations, most of which telecast in French.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel has an internet connection on the first floor (beware of the non-qwerty keyboard) and a beautiful bar and lovely breakfast room on the same floor as the hotel reception. Breakfast was superb.
reviews.title: A real find in Old Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at LHotel for a week in early October. The hotel is lovely--though the entrance is a little funky. The staff members are so friendly and seem to really enjoy their jobs. We enjoyed the bar at night after dinner, and we enjoyed the breakfast (which came with our room). The breakfast is continental but includes both boiled and deviled (!) eggs, ham, wonderful cheeses, delicious pastries, as well as the usual cereal, bagels, fruit, etc. The breakfast area is quite nice and the service impeccable.
reviews.title: A lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a king junior suite (room 412). The room is really large, as is the bathroom. It was well appointed and comfortable . We even had two full length mirrors. Our only complaint with the room and bath was that they were rather dark. We were down at the end of the hall, and we heard nothing from neighboring rooms. Sometimes we heard a door slam, but that was all--except for the lovely bells from nearby Notre Dame Basilica.
reviews.title: Location and comfort all rolled into one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We thought the location was the best. We wanted to be in Old Montreal and were concerned that the hotel was not really "in" the area. After walking around Old Montreal, we were really glad we had chosen LHotel instead of some of the others we had considered because of the congestion in that Old Montreal area. The area around our hotel was quiet, only a couple of short blocks from wonderful restaurants and the old part of the city.
reviews.title: wonderful stay in old montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would we recommend this hotel? Absolutely!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The LHotel exceeded our expectations from the minute we arrived at the front and were greeted by the doorman and escorted us to the front desk. the staff upgraded our room to a beautiful suite. We were able to valet park our car at a convenient parking garage and walk to restaurants and sights in Old Montreal City. The staff was helpful and polite and the downstairs lounge was a great spot to unwind with a nightcap at the end of a busy day.
reviews.title: Lovely staff, good location, comfortable room & nice breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have never experienced such friendly, helpful, personal service as I did at the LHotel. My five friends and I were on our annual trip, and we all were absolutely delighted with LHotel. In addition to what other reviews have stated, I would like to highlight the hotel's breakfast buffet. Have you ever seen deviled eggs at a hotel breakfast? They were scrumptious! There was always a great variety of delicious food. Here's an example of the personal attention: The waitresses noticed that some of our group ate granola and yogurt for breakfast, so on our last day, they put out beautiful bowls of granola and yogurt mixed together and decorated with fruit. And, by the way, the coffee was excellent, and cups were refilled regularly. The Front Desk folks were also very attentive and found all information that we asked of them. They even checked with us after we returned to ask if we had enjoyed our excursion.
reviews.title: Top Notch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent a night in July 2011 before continuing our trip up to Quebec City, and the hotel is absolutely amazing. There were two original Marc Chagalls on the walls in our room!!!. The entrance hall and corridor were filled with works of art ranging from pictures and drawings of Miró, Andy Warhol, Botero and lots of painters and sculptors, interesting pieces of furniture and photographs.
reviews.title: It's like staying in a museum

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very spacious, with a big flat-screen TV and lots of channels. The bathroom was average, though.
reviews.title: Comfort and elegance in Montreal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: As for the staff, they were very nice, really. Location is absolutely great. But LHotel stands out because of its bizarre art collection worth spending a night there or having a drink in the bar.
reviews.title: Great Stay at L'Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: LHotel was a wonderful surprise for us! The photos and reviews are absolutely accurate! Rooms/beds are comfortable, quiet and very well appointed. The hotel lobby is FILLED with amazing art - wonderful place to relax with a glass of wine. The location of the hotel is very central to Old Montreal, the Port, the bike path, good restaurants, Notre Dame. Park your car and walk. Service at the hotel is top-notch - best doormen in the city! All the staff was friendly and helpful. We only ate the continental breakfast one time in the hotel - it is an added cost. Parking is also an added cost. You would expect these costs in a major metropolitan city. I would return to this hotel in a minute, if I was in Montreal again. You have the comfortable feeling of a smaller hotel with an international elegance. Don't miss it!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have stayed in L'hotel for one nigh while visiting customers in Montreal. From the outside the hotel looks nice and as you walk in through a bunch of stairs, the lobby is small but functional. The checkin desk is on the right and the hotel has a single slow elevator which can e a bottle-neck during peak times. The room I was given - a single king on the forth floor was well appointed although a little spartan and had a mini-bar. The bed was not very formfortable, compared to other beds offered today by the better brands. The bathroom was OK - although, don't plan to fill the tab. It took me about 30 minutes or more because of the very low stream of water coming out.
reviews.title: Boutique hotel that's OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: One majot complaint I have is the sound isolation. Basically you can hear any door open or close in the entire floor, private conversations and more. The walls are paper thin. The one thing that the hotel has going for it is location. On the border between new/old montreal you can use it as a base for exploring both.
reviews.title: Great location and terrific staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All-in-all, the hotel is OK, but not good. Having stayed at a Sheraton the other night - definitly not in the same group.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay, great hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very helpful. Location was terrific -- half a block from the St. James Hotel -- three blocks from.Notre Dame Free wireless. A little on the pricey side, though (I paid $260) -- but Montreal seems to be pretty pricey.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for those who want to splurge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The "business center" is in the same room with the "fitness center" -- which makes it a little impractical to actually work in. The free wireless / combined with a nice work space in the room makes it largely a non-issue.
reviews.title: Excellent, well located hotel

description: DARE TO BE ORIGINAL! More than just a hotel, this landmark historic renovated bank is now home to one of the most impressive private art collections in North America on permanent display both in the public spaces as well as our guest rooms and suites. Over 120 Contemporary and Pop artworks feature Litchenstein, Warhol, Miro, Chagall and Botero to name a few. Furthermore, this artful and creative experience extends well beyond the hotel thanks to our Cultural Curator. Elegant, spacious and eclectic, our 59 rooms and suites feature lofty ceilings with large windows, spacious work areas, and luxurious bathrooms and exquisite furnishings. Enjoy daily breakfast served in the privacy of your guestroom or in the Winter Garden Dining Room. Our Botero Wine Bar features private imports by the glass, specially chosen to provide unforgettable tasting experience. Sam Francis Gym, massage room, business center and conference rooms and complimentary WiFi will help make your business or leisure travels unique and memorable. Where else can you have breakfast with Warhol, drinks with Botero and sleep with Litchenstein? Yes, all of our suites and junior suites have original works by world renowned artists! The rooms are memorable but the experience is unforgettable! LHotel is located in the heart of Old Montreal, just steps from the Business District, the Montreal Convention Center, the Old Port and trendy McGill Street. Historic, Artful, Urban. We're more than just a hotel- we're LHotel Montréal...Dare to be original...
